overview: From 2025-10-16 to 2025-10-17, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 16 new PRs (13 merged), 3 new issues, and 38 active contributors.

topIssues.title: [DA Footprint Limit] add unit tests
topIssues.author: geoknee
topIssues.body:
In op-geth 
 
* Build a block with a fixed DA footprint
* vary the `da_footprint_gas_scalar`
* ensure `gasUsed` changes once the scaled up value exceeds the actual gas used

still open how to do it the easiest way, reusing existing test utils.

topIssues.title: op-conductor :Failed to start sequencer, err="no unsafe head"
topIssues.author: wluisw
topIssues.body: I originally deployed a sequencer to generate blocks normally. 1. After I linked the conductor, the sequencer stopped generating blocks: op-node log conductor log: 2. The log after I called the conductor conductor_resume rpc interfaceÔºö 3. Config op-node : ```# Sequencer configuration SEQUENCER_ENABLED=true SEQUENCER_STOPPED=false OP_NODE_P2P_NO_DISCOVERY=true OP_NODE_CONDUCTOR_ENABLED=true OP_NODE_CONDUCTOR_RPC=http://127.0.0.1:9547 ``` op-conductor: ```OP_CONDUCTOR_CONSENSUS_ADDR=0.0.0.0 OP_CONDUCTOR_CONSENSUS_ADVERTISED=127.0.0.1:50050 OP_CONDUCTOR_CONSENSUS_PORT=50050 OP_CONDUCTOR_EXECUTION_RPC=http://127.0.0.1:8545 OP_CONDUCTOR_HEALTHCHECK_INTERVAL=1 OP_CONDUCTOR_HEALTHCHECK_MIN_PEER_COUNT=2 OP_CONDUCTOR_HEALTHCHECK_UNSAFE_INTERVAL=60 OP_CONDUCTOR_NODE_RPC=http://127.0.0.1:8547 OP_CONDUCTOR_RAFT_SERVER_ID=conductor0 OP_CONDUCTOR_RAFT_STORAGE_DIR=./raft OP_CONDUCTOR_RPC_ENABLE_PROXY=true OP_CONDUCTOR_RPC_ENABLE_ADMIN=true OP_CONDUCTOR_RAFT_BOOTSTRAP=true OP_CONDUCTOR_PAUSED=true OP_CONDUCTOR_RPC_PORT=9547 OP_CONDUCTOR_RPC_ADDR=0.0.0.0 OP_CONDUCTORHEALTHCHECK_MIN_PEER_COUNT=1 ``` Can someone help me see what the reason is? Thank you very much.

topIssues.title: demote and lighten op-opn-geth-a-sequencer-1 of sepolia
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body:
After provisioning the op-opn-geth-f-sequencer-3 in sepolia, op-opn-geth-a-sequencer-1 can have flashblocks-components detached from it and also, have it stepped out of the voter set.

This way, op-opn-geth-a-sequencer-1 can act a backup vanilla non-flashblocks sequencer capable of serving the rollup-boost kill switch in case of catastrophic situations.

topPRs.title: op-acceptance-tests: Reorg then gap filling tests
topPRs.author: pcw109550
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

Added three tests, which demonstrates that the op-node can follow the unsafe tip of the sequencer by filling in the gap.

The gap-filling method is currently done by the ReqRes sync, and it will be substituted by Multiple EL Sync which is implemented at [op-node: update OnUnsafeL2Payload to perform ELSync gap filling](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/17751).

This means, if this PR is first merged then then [op-node: update OnUnsafeL2Payload to perform ELSync gap filling](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/17751) is merged, the **tests should still pass for both syncmodes: `sync.ELSync` and `sync.CLSync` since both options will allow multiple EL Syncs**.

**Tests**

The tests leverage the `TestSequencer`, which can trigger L1 reorg, leading L2 {safe|unsafe} reorg. All three test case use RR Sync to fill in the unsafe gap. 

#### `TestUnsafeGapFillAfterSafeReorg`

```
// TestUnsafeGapFillAfterSafeReorg demonstrates the sequence:
//  1. Verifier CLP2P is disconnected and Verifier CL is stopped.
//  2. Safe reorg occurs because L1 reorged.
//  3. Verifier restarts, and consolidation drops the verifier previously-unsafe blocks.
//  4. CLP2P is restored, the verifier backfills and the unsafe gap is closed.
```

#### `TestUnsafeGapFillAfterUnsafeReorg_RestartL2CL`

```
// TestUnsafeGapFillAfterUnsafeReorg_RestartL2CL demonstrates the flow where:
//  1. Verifier L2CL is stopped.
//  2. Unsafe reorg occurs because L1 reorged,
//  3. Verifier restarts and detects the L1 reorg, triggering its own unsafe reorg,
//  4. Verifier then backfills and closes the unsafe gap once reconnected via CLP2P.
```

#### `TestUnsafeGapFillAfterUnsafeReorg_RestartCLP2P`

```
// TestUnsafeGapFillAfterUnsafeReorg_RestartCLP2P demonstrates the flow where:
//  1. Verifier CLP2P is disconnected.
//  2. Unsafe reorg occurs because L1 reorged.
//  3. Verifier detects the L1 reorg, triggering its own unsafe reorg.
//  4. CLP2P is restored Verifier, the verifier backfills and the unsafe gap is closed.
```

**Additional Context**

About the flakiness of newly added tests: At https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/ethereum-optimism/optimism?branch=pcw109550%2Facceptance-test-sync-reorg I triggered acceptance tests pipeline 8 times, and newly added tests never flaked.

We must add `WithNoDiscovery` preset to make L2CL not discover peers automatically

**Metadata**

Part of https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/17694

completedItems.title: fix(op-acceptance-tests): flaky tests; less filtering
completedItems.body:
Updates the Flaky Tests Report:
- Simplifies logic
- Always generates an HTML report (even if no flaky tests)
- Eases the branch filtering we attempted and instead relies on CircleCI's

completedItems.title: make all _TestInit contracts abstract
completedItems.body: These contracts don't need to run, so they can all be abstract. Local testing suggests this saves about 30 seconds during the build.

completedItems.title: op-supernode: update readme
completedItems.body: Updated README.md to clarify virtual node configuration and metrics routing.

completedItems.title: op-deployer: re-enable v3 upgrade test with new fork blockNum
completedItems.body: Fork sepolia at the blockNum immediately before op-sepolia was upgraded to `op-contracts/v3.0.0` when testing the upgrade
